title: Established Business in Australia visa (subclass 845)
summary: This page provides information for applicants who previously applied for the Established Business in Australia visa (subclass 845), which closed to new applications on 1 July 2012. It explains application procedures for existing applicants, family member additions, requirements, costs, and postâ€‘lodgement processes. It also outlines documentation needed and decision outcomes.

visa_details.application_availability: You cannot apply for this visa.
visa_details.alternative_options: Other business visa options available via SkillSelect.

applicant_information.who_this_is_for: Applicants who already lodged a subclass 845 visa application and are awaiting a decision.

adding_family_members.policy: You can add members of your family unit at any time until the visa is decided.
requirements: Must meet requirements for including family members
Must provide documentary evidence of relationship
Must meet health and character requirements
Might need to take IELTS test

forms_required.description: Application for a Business Skills (provisional) visa
forms_required.purpose: Used to add dependent children or other family members

health_requirements.general: Applicants must meet certain health requirements.
notes: Most applicants will not be required to complete additional health examinations.
Applicants should not arrange a health examination until instructed.

character_requirements.general: Applicants must meet certain character requirements.
character_requirements.police_certificate_requirement: Provide a police certificate from each country lived in for 12 months or more during the past 10 years after turning 16.

debts_to_government.requirement: Applicants must have no outstanding debts to the Australian Government or have arrangements in place to repay them.

costs.notes: Applicants are responsible for arranging and paying for other costs.

lodging_application.instructions: Lodge completed forms and documents in person or by registered post, courier or fax.
lodging_application.attention: Client Services, Adelaide Business Skills Processing Centre

after_applying.acknowledgement: The department will acknowledge receipt of the application.

outside_australia: Do not make travel arrangements until advised in writing that the visa is granted.
Wait for a decision before leaving job, selling home, or booking travel.
in_australia: Applicant may be eligible for a Bridging visa.
If granted a Bridging visa A, applicant can apply for a Bridging visa B to travel outside Australia.

providing_more_information.policy: Applicants can provide more information at any time until a decision is made.
providing_more_information.department_requests: The department may request more information with a set response date.
providing_more_information.third_party_information: Applicants are usually given an opportunity to comment if adverse information is received.

changes_to_report: Changes to phone number, email, address, or passport
required_information_when_reporting: ABN (or other business identifier for businesses outside Australia)

if_granted: When you can use the visa
if_refused: Time limit for lodging an appeal
visa_decision.sponsor_rights: Where applicable, sponsor may apply for review.

notes: Provide certified copies of original documents.
Do not include original documents unless specifically requested.
Documents not in English must include accredited English translations.

forms.description: Application for a Business Skills (permanent) visa
Details of child or other dependent family member aged 18 years or over
forms.applicable_to: Family members aged 18 or older (not partner)

forms.description: Personal particulars for assessment including character assessment

identity_documents: Certified copies of biographical passport pages for all applicants
Two recent passport-sized photos (45mm x 35mm) for each applicant (head and shoulders only, plain background, name written on back)
Certified evidence of name change if applicable
family_documents: Certified copies of birth certificates or family book showing both parents' names for dependent children
Certified adoption papers for adopted dependent children
If bringing a child under 18 and the other parent is not included: documentary evidence of legal right to bring the child to Australia
